title: Enlightened
description: Do you believe that plants can communicate?The botanical world holds a rich, rooted history, and it is alive, speaking to us today!Lydia Blue's passion is for wild things!  Living and working in Colorado, Lydia becomes acquainted with a man named Stone. She continues to brush shoulders with this handsome but seemingly hard-hearted co-worker.  Together they unravel a tribal plot that seems harmless to Stone, but Lydia is unwavering in her curiosity.  Stone's fascination with this strong-willed woman is persistent, and he is not shy to let her know.Ada Pearl, Lydia's precious Grandmother, is her inspiration. With the gift of foresight, Ada is often Liddy's guide to life's challenges.  Ada is a medicine woman, dwelling in her cozy mountain home, awaiting her granddaughters' visits.  Their bond is strong, grounded in love for one another, knowledge of nature's healing power, and respect for the Great Creator.Can Lydia and her grandmother unveil the truth of this legend?  Will Stone stand in their way?  Travel through this book of the mysterious botanical realm and a battle of light versus darkness.*BONUS:  Herbal Medicine Recipes at the end of the book!
author: Cara Iris Miller
